solution_line_template: 13 were yellow and white, and 14 red and white, for a total of {yellow_white_flowers}+{red_white_flowers}=<<{yellow_white_flowers}+{red_white_flowers}={total_white_flowers}>>{total_white_flowers} flowers containing the color white.

17 were red and yellow, and 14 were red and white, for a total of {red_yellow_flowers}+{red_white_flowers}=<<{red_yellow_flowers}+{red_white_flowers}={total_red_flowers}>>{total_red_flowers} flowers containing the color red.

Thus, there were {total_red_flowers}-{total_white_flowers}=<<{total_red_flowers}-{total_white_flowers}={difference_red_white}>>{difference_red_white} more flowers that contained the color red than the color white.
